data.text:
Francis Bayley1

M, #123071, b. 6 February 1803, d. 1893

Last Edited=20 Sep 2013

Francis Bayley was born on 6 February 1803.2 He was the son of Rt. Hon. Sir John Bayley, 1st Bt. and Elizabeth Markett.1,3 He married, firstly, Elizabeth Macdonald, daughter of Alexander Macdonald, on 31 August 1830.2 He married, secondly, Charlotte Roulet, daughter of Frederic Roulet, on 17 April 1854.2 He died in 1893.2

He held the office of Justice of the Court of Exchequer between 1830 and 1834.1 He was a practising barrister.2 He held the office of Judge of the Westminster County Court.1

Children of Francis Bayley and Elizabeth Macdonald

Louisa Frances Bayley1 d. 2 Feb 1900

Major John Arthur Bayley3 b. 1831, d. 4 Feb 1903

Citations

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, editor, The Complete Baronetage, 5 volumes (no date (c. 1900); reprint, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 1983), volume V, page 131. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Baronetage.

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 2254. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Rt. Hon. Sir John Bayley, 1st Bt.1

M, #123072, b. 3 August 1763, d. 10 October 1841

Last Edited=20 Sep 2013

Rt. Hon. Sir John Bayley, 1st Bt. was born on 3 August 1763.2 He was the son of John Bayley and Sarah Kennett.3 He married Elizabeth Markett, daughter of John Markett, on 20 May 1790.2 He died on 10 October 1841 at age 78.2

He was appointed Knight in 1808.2 He held the office of Baron of the Exchequer.2 He held the office of Judge of the King's Bench.2 He was created 1st Baronet Bayley, of Bedford Square, Middlesex [U.K.] on 15 March 1834.1

Children of Rt. Hon. Sir John Bayley, 1st Bt. and Elizabeth Markett

Marianne Bayley+3 d. 24 Apr 1858

Lucy Bayley3 d. Jul 1820

Elizabeth Magdalene Bayley3 d. 26 Feb 1878

Sir John Edward George Bayley, 2nd Bt.+3 b. 23 Dec 1793, d. 23 Dec 1871

Reverend Kennett Champain Bayley+3 b. 13 Oct 1798, d. 2 Jun 1861

Francis Bayley+1 b. 6 Feb 1803, d. 1893

Citations

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, editor, The Complete Baronetage, 5 volumes (no date (c. 1900); reprint, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 1983), volume V, page 131. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Baronetage.

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 2254. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Elizabeth Macdonald1

F, #123073, d. 8 April 1838

Last Edited=20 Sep 2013

Elizabeth Macdonald was the daughter of Alexander Macdonald.1 She married Francis Bayley, son of Rt. Hon. Sir John Bayley, 1st Bt. and Elizabeth Markett, on 31 August 1830.2 She died on 8 April 1838.2

She lived Westminster.2 Her married name became Bayley.1

Children of Elizabeth Macdonald and Francis Bayley

Louisa Frances Bayley1 d. 2 Feb 1900

Major John Arthur Bayley3 b. 1831, d. 4 Feb 1903

Citations

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, editor, The Complete Baronetage, 5 volumes (no date (c. 1900); reprint, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 1983), volume V, page 131. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Baronetage.

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 2254. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Alexander Macdonald1

M, #123074

Last Edited=27 Dec 2011

Alexander Macdonald lived at London, England .1

Child of Alexander Macdonald

Elizabeth Macdonald+1 d. 8 Apr 1838

Citations

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, editor, The Complete Baronetage, 5 volumes (no date (c. 1900); reprint, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 1983), volume V, page 131. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Baronetage.

Sir John Anderson, 1st Bt.1

M, #123075, b. 1612, d. July 1630

Last Edited=1 Dec 2013

Sir John Anderson, 1st Bt. was born in 1612.2 He was the son of Sir Francis Anderson and Hon. Audrey Boteler.1 He died in July 1630 at Apscourt, Walton-on-Thames, Surrey, England , unmarried.1 He died intestate and his estate was administered to his mother, Lady Baroness Dunsmore on 2 August 1630.1

He was created 1st Baronet Anderson, of St. Ives, co. Huntingdon [England] on 3 January 1628/29.1

Citations

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, editor, The Complete Baronetage, 5 volumes (no date (c. 1900); reprint, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 1983), volume II, page 65. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Baronetage.

[S3268] Hans Harmsen, "re: Chester Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 21 August 2008. Hereinafter cited as "re: Chester Family."

Sir Francis Anderson1

M, #123076, b. 1581, d. 22 December 1615

Last Edited=1 Dec 2013

Sir Francis Anderson was born in 1581.2 He was the son of Sir Edmund Anderson.1 He married, firstly, Judith Soame, daughter of Sir Stephen Soame and Anne Stone, in 1606 at London, England.2 He married, secondly, Hon. Audrey Boteler, daughter of John Boteler, 1st Baron Boteler of Brantfield and Elizabeth Villiers, in 1611.1,2 He died on 22 December 1615.1 He was also reported to have died on 22 December 1616.3,4

He lived at Eyworth, Bedfordshire, England .1

Children of Sir Francis Anderson and Judith Soame

Edmund Anderson+2 b. 1607, d. 4 Apr 1638

Stephen Anderson+3 b. 1608, d. a Jun 1664

Child of Sir Francis Anderson and Hon. Audrey Boteler

Sir John Anderson, 1st Bt.1 b. 1612, d. Jul 1630

Citations

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, editor, The Complete Baronetage, 5 volumes (no date (c. 1900); reprint, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 1983), volume II, page 65. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Baronetage.

[S3268] Hans Harmsen, "re: Chester Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 21 August 2008. Hereinafter cited as "re: Chester Family."

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, The Complete Baronetage, volume III, page 294.

[S6] G.E. Cokayne; with Vicary Gibbs, H.A. Doubleday, Geoffrey H. White, Duncan Warrand and Lord Howard de Walden, editors, The Complete Peerage of England, Scotland, Ireland, Great Britain and the United Kingdom, Extant, Extinct or Dormant, new ed., 13 volumes in 14 (1910-1959; reprint in 6 volumes, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 2000), volume III, page 194. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Peerage.

Hon. Audrey Boteler1

F, #123077, b. 1595, d. 16 September 1652

Last Edited=1 Dec 2013

Hon. Audrey Boteler was born in 1595.2 She was the daughter of John Boteler, 1st Baron Boteler of Brantfield and Elizabeth Villiers.1 She married, firstly, Sir Francis Anderson, son of Sir Edmund Anderson, in 1611.1,2 She married, secondly, Francis Leigh, 1st Earl of Chichester, son of Sir Francis Leigh and Hon. Mary Egerton, from 1617 to 1618.1 She died on 16 September 1652.3

From 1611, her married name became Anderson.1 Her married name became Leigh.1 After her marriage, Hon. Audrey Boteler was styled as Baroness Dunsmore on 31 July 1628.1

Child of Hon. Audrey Boteler and Sir Francis Anderson

Sir John Anderson, 1st Bt.1 b. 1612, d. Jul 1630

Citations

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, editor, The Complete Baronetage, 5 volumes (no date (c. 1900); reprint, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 1983), volume II, page 65. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Baronetage.

Hereinafter cited as The Complete Peerage.

Sir Richard Anderson1

M, #123078, d. 3 August 1630

Last Edited=22 May 2008

Sir Richard Anderson was the son of Sir Henry Anderson.1 He died on 3 August 1630.1

Children of Sir Richard Anderson and Hon. Mary Spencer

Robert Anderson2

Sir Henry Anderson, 1st Bt.+1 b. c 1608, d. 7 Jul 1653

Citations

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, editor, The Complete Baronetage, 5 volumes (no date (c. 1900); reprint, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 1983), volume II, page 211. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Baronetage.

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, The Complete Baronetage, volume II, page 212.

Sir Henry Anderson1

M, #123079, d. 13 April 1605

Last Edited=13 Mar 2009

Sir Henry Anderson died on 13 April 1605.1

He held the office of Sheriff of London from 1601 to 1602.1 He lived at St. Olaves, Norfolk, England .1

Children of Sir Henry Anderson

Sir Richard Anderson+1 d. 3 Aug 1630

Sarah Anderson+2 d. 1615

Frances Anderson+3

Citations

[S15] George Edward Cokayne, editor, The Complete Baronetage, 5 volumes (no date (c. 1900); reprint, Gloucester, U.K.: Alan Sutton Publishing, 1983), volume II, page 211. Hereinafter cited as The Complete Baronetage.
